result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
dated 10-18-2022, filed by Atty Jensen requesting to adjourn the hearing on 10-20-2022

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 10-19-2022: The matter may be rescheduled.**

8:44 AM Defendant Richard J. Leonardi in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Richard J. Leonardi.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Zachary A Wittchow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Waive reading of Information. Preliminary hearing waived, bound over.  Information filed, reading waived.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:27 AM Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen in court.   Defendant Richard J. Leonardi did not appear.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Jensen states a reasons for the Defendant's non appearance as he is in treatment and states he filed a letter to that effect.
ADA Thompson presents statements and requests a capias stayed.
Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
The Court will adjourn.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn Preliminary Hearing
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 06-27-2022. "Granted if no objection from State as time limits waived and no Marsy's Law issues. If no objection, matter will be a status on Prelim. Defense counsel and Defendant may appear by Zoom or in person."

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:07 PM Defendant Richard J. Leonardi in court with State Public Defender Law Intern.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
